meanings.definition: A plant trained to grow flat against a wall or trellis.
meanings.sent1: The garden had beautiful espaliers of roses along the fence.
meanings.sent2: She carefully tended to the espaliers of fruit trees in her backyard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the espaliers as a secret pathway to steal apples.
meanings.sent4: The espaliers of ivy on the old building created a green tapestry against the brick walls.
meanings.sent5: The espaliers of jasmine bloomed in a cascade of white flowers, creating a fragrant wall.

meanings.definition: The art or technique of training plants to grow flat against a wall or trellis.
meanings.sent1: Learning about espaliers helped her transform her garden into a work of art.
meanings.sent2: The master gardener shared his secrets of espaliers with the eager students.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy gardener's attempt at espaliers turned out to be a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: Her skill in creating espaliers was like painting a living mural on the garden wall.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns of the espaliers resembled nature's own form of wall art.
